mosinstall.description:
Core Design Scriptegrator plugin for Joomla! 1.0

Description: Core Design Scriptegrator plugin. Integrate the different scripts (CSS, JS, PHP) for use with our other extensions.

Version: 1.1.4 (released on March 6th, 2008)

Author: Daniel Rataj, www.greatjoomla.com

Extensions for use with this plugin

Please visit our websites for more information.

param.name: outlineType
param.label: Rounded
param.description: Official reference: The outline type refers to PNG graphics within the outlines directory. These graphic outlines appear outside the CSS border after the image is fully expanded.

param.name: outlineWhileAnimating
param.label: Outline while animating
param.description: Official reference: HTML content on the other hand is much less processor heavy, and a graphic outline while animating looks very good and distinguishes the popup from the background.

param.name: showCredits
param.label: Show Highslide Credits
param.description: Official reference: There are no licence considerations in this; both commercial and non-commercial users can freely remove the credits label.

param.name: expandDuration
param.label: Expand Duration
param.description: Official reference: Defines in milliseconds how long the zoom in effect should take.

param.name: anchor
param.label: Anchor
param.description: Official reference: The default setting is 'auto', which means the image tries to expand equally in all directions, but moves and/or contracts if it exceeds the client area.

param.name: align
param.label: Align
param.description: Official reference: Position of the full image in the client.

param.name: transitions
param.label: Transition
param.description: Official reference: The transitions property is an array with one or two items. The first item applies to opening or closing the expander on it's own. If a second parameter is given, this will apply when hs.previous or hs.next is called through links or key listeners.

param.name: dimmingOpacity
param.label: Dimming Opacity
param.description: Official reference: The dimmingOpacity property creates the popular Lightbox darkening/lightening background effect. Setting dimmingOpacity to 0 disables the effect.
